text.name: post-it
text.text: Pink for the body, grey for the eyes, green forâ€¦hmm

text.name: post-it
text.text: Don't look into the dull ones

text.name: post-it
text.text: If the mathematician asks for me, I was never here

text.name: post-it
text.text: Our clears keep waking up from screaming nightmares.  Higher-ups say it's nothing

text.name: post-it
text.text: Subject can lift 14.82g.  15g or higher causes migraine

text.name: post-it
text.text: ONYX LIGHTNING?  GRAY DAWN?  COLD BELOW?  VERDANT HAND?  Oh come on

text.name: post-it
text.text: I can't believe she wants to call them psi-cops

text.name: post-it
text.text: Two more subjects overloaded.  Need to request more

text.name: post-it
text.text: Maybe a teep can communicate with them

text.name: post-it
text.text: Reminder: Tell the immersion teams we need more samples

text.name: post-it
text.text: It won't kill you but you'll wish it had

text.name: post-it
text.text: Animal testing approved.  Try the TK on the mice

text.name: post-it
text.text: Can't wait for cross-testing.  Will PE050 boost it?

text.name: post-it
text.text: She tried to scan Y65-08.  Now in a coma

text.name: post-it
text.text: Scanning them doesn't work.  It's just static

text.name: testing report
text.text:
Subject is female, of East Asian descent, age 35 years.  In good health.

Initial test using standard deck of playing cards.  Subject and experimenter facing away from each other, with opaque curtain blocking line of sight.  Prompt was triggered by a light on subject's desk to prevent drawing any information from experimenter's tone of voice or word choice.  Experimenter drew ten cards and asked subject to state number and suit.  Cards are shuffled back into the deck after each guess to prevent already-drawn cards from affecting future guesses.

Results: Subject guessed two of ten correct on the first test and three of ten correct on the second test, versus control who guessed a single card correct on the first test and zero correct on the second test.  Very promising initial results.

text.name: incident report
text.text:
INCIDENT REPORT: 897237

During a routine visit by Dr. Davies, at 1134 a COLD BELOW mathematician diverted from their standard schedule and entered the room where Dr. Davies was being briefed about netherum mathematics developments.  The mathematician stared at Dr. Davies for approximately three seconds and then, before security could intervene, physically attacked the doctor with their bare hands.  Witnesses report the mathematician incoherently screaming, mixed with statements such as "You'll kill us all" and "Stop, stop stop".  The mathematician continued to scream until restrained and sedated.

Follow-up: COLD BELOW overseers received official reprimand and required to attend additional training.  Mathematician diverted to project SUBSTRATE.
